div.div: 400 E. Gamble Rd, Fayette, OH 43521 | P: 419-237-2573

div.span: interested in Preschool for the 2020-2021 school year, Fayette Local School needs you to complete the

, so that we have the appropriate information to plan for preschool for the 2020-2021 school year. Preschool screening is currently postponed. We will send out more information about preschool in the future. This form is the first step to register for preschool this year. *We need this completed even if you have already turned in your preschool paper enrollment packet. Those required forms are filed in the office. Everyone will still need to complete them once we are able to return to school.*

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:18px

span.span: Attention parents of students that will be 5 on or before August 1st. We need you to complete the

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;font-size:18px;color:mediumblue
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size:18px

span.span: , so that we have the appropriate information to plan for kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year. Kindergarten screening is currently postponed. We will re-schedule and send out scheduling information for that as soon as we are able.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Fayette Local School(FLS) is closely monitoring the coronavirus (COVID-19) and the government regulations for schools. FLS is committed to following all guidance from local, state, and federal health experts for K-12 schools in its response to COVID-19. In an effort to keep school and community informed, FLS has released the following information to the public.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: FLS will be sharing additional updates or modifications to our school website as more information becomes available. We are continuing to work with faculty and staff and our district will provide additional guidance in the coming days. This will be an evolving process and FLS asks for everyone’s patience.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Finally, FLS wants to thank the individuals in our community who are working hard to keep us safe and control the spread of this virus. This is a time for our community to come together and FLS is confident in our ability to navigate through this unique situation.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This statement supersedes all previous communication to the public or staff. Please note that this information is accurate as of

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #ff0000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: April 16, 2020 – 11:15 AM. New updates will be in red.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-style: italic; font-weight: 700; white-space: pre-wrap
background-color:#fafafa; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Any Fayette Student can recieve free meals.Starting April 20th meals for the week will be delivered on Mondays.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #ff0000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
color: #ff0000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;font-size:14px
background-color: #fefefe; color: #ff0000
span.p: Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription and at any service level up to 100 Mbps.
To enroll call 1-844-488-8395. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #ff0000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 13px; background-color: #fefefe; color: #ff0000

li.span: Spectrum does not have data caps or hidden fees.
When you dial in you will select the option for new account or new sales state that you are applying for the free 60 day internet.
Spectrum will set up a time to install the equipment and set up service.

t the end of 60 days you may cancel the service or you may continue with spectrum. Charter will continue to offer Spectrum Internet Assist, high speed broadband program to eligible low-income households delivering speeds of 30 Mbps.
Spectrum will deny free service if there is a past due bill.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;color:#000000
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Due to current government regulations, FLS will be closed Monday March 16, thru April 3, 2020. During this time the FLS building will be closed to staff/students and the public.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: FLS will follow the guidance from local and state health officials in its response to the COVID-19.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: FLS After School Events & Athletic Events

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Today the Ohio High School Athletic Association suspended interscholastic athletics beginning Friday, March 13, at 11:59 PM. After careful consideration, FLS has opted to cancel all athletic events and practices beginning Thursday afternoon until further notice. Additionally, until further notice all FLS after school events and activities are canceled.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Until further notice, all district-wide events will be closed to the staff/students and public to help prevent the spread of contact with individuals.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: All travel for student field trips, student competitions, and staff professional travel for conferences or trainings is under review at this time.

span.div: You are able to pay your student fees and lunch accounts online using PaySchool.&nbsp
Please use the Absence Hotline to call us for your student's absence.
The link below will provide more information on the proposed settlement on ODE's website.

img.title: MEC presenting a check to Mrs. Killam
img.alt: MEC presenting a check to Mrs. Killam
img.span: Mrs. Killam was awarded a grant from Patty Clark of Midwest Energy & communications! Our STEAM students helped to surprise Mrs. Killam by presenting the check on MEC's behalf. We are extremely grateful for the grant and all Mrs. Killam does for our students!

div.small: Students, employees, guests and visitors can report violations of the technical standards or any accessibility concerns to the Web Accessibility Coordinator, including requests to provide access or notification to the District of content or functionality that is inaccessible by emailing [email protected]. Individuals seeking to obtain information regarding how to file formal complaints regarding Section 504 is a part of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 or the Americans with Disabilities Act should visit www.ADA.gov <https://www.ada.gov/> or contact either the Elementary or High School Principals, who are the District's Compliance Officers.
